intro: Veronica armstrongii, commonly known as Armstrong's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
